doc.description:
An all-in-one hierarchical options management system
 *
This class allows to:
---------------------
* manage a **hierarchical** table of options
* retrieve, edit, add, remove options
* grab a whole tree
* apply functions on group of options
* add user-defined properties
* set option configuration and applies it to all its children
* And many more...

name: bbn\Appui\Options

get_options.name: get_options
get_options.summary: Returns the existing instance if there is

arguments.name: db
arguments.description: configuration array

parent.name: check
parent.summary: Checks whether the error property has been set (so an error happened).

init.name: init

delete_cache.name: delete_cache
delete_cache.summary: Deletes the options' cache, specifically for an ID or globally
delete_cache.description:
If specific, it will also destroy the cache of the parent
   *
```php
$opt->option->deleteCache(25)
// This is chainable
// ->...
```

description_parts.content: If specific, it will also destroy the cache of the parent *

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The option's ID

arguments.name: deep
arguments.description: If sets to true, children's cache will also be deleted

arguments.name: subs
arguments.description: Used internally only for deleting children's cache without their parent

get_class_cfg.name: get_class_cfg
get_class_cfg.summary: Returns the configuration array of the class with the table structure

from_code.name: from_code
from_code.summary: Gets an option ID from diverse combinations of elements:

description_parts.content:
• A code or a serie of codes from the most specific to a child of the root
  • A code or a serie of codes and an id_parent where to find the last code
  • A code alone having $this->default as parent *

set_value.name: set_value

get_root.name: get_root
get_root.summary: Returns the ID of the root option - mother of all

get_default.name: get_default
get_default.summary: Returns the ID of the default option ($id_parent used when not provided)

set_default.name: set_default
set_default.summary: Makes an option act as if it was the root option

description_parts.content: It will be the default $id_parent for options requested by code *

items.name: items
items.summary: Returns an array of the children's IDs of the given option sorted by order or text

native_option.name: native_option
native_option.summary: Returns an option's row as stored in its original form in the database
native_option.description:
*
```php
bbn\X::dump($opt->nativeOption(25));
/*
array [
  'id' => 25,
  'code' => "bbn_ide",
  'text' => "BBN's own IDE",
  'id_alias' => null,
  'value' => "{\"myProperty\":\"My property's value\"}"
]
```

native_options.name: native_options

raw_option.name: raw_option
raw_option.summary: Returns an option's row as stored in its original form in the database, including cfg
raw_option.description:
*
```php
bbn\X::dump($opt->rawOption('database', 'appui'));
/*
array [
  'id' => "77cea323f0ce11e897fd525400007196",
  'code' => "bbn_ide",
  'text' => "BBN's own IDE",
  'cfg' => null,
  'id_alias' => null,
  'value' => "{\"num\":1}"
]
```

raw_options.name: raw_options
raw_options.summary: Returns an option's items  as stored in its original form in the database, including cfg
raw_options.description:
*
```php
bbn\X::dump($opt->rawOptions('database', 'appui'));
/*
[
  [
     'id' => "77cea323f0ce11e897fd525400007196",
     'code' => "bbn_ide",
     'text' => "BBN's own IDE",
     'cfg' => null,
     'id_alias' => null,
     'value' => "{\"num\":1}"
   ], [
     'id' => "77cea323f0ce11e897fd525400007196",
     'code' => "bbn_ide",
     'text' => "BBN's own IDE",
     'cfg' => null,
     'id_alias' => null,
     'value' => "{\"num\":1}"
   ]
]
```

description_parts.content:
bbn\X::dump($opt->rawOptions('database', 'appui'));
/*
[
  [
     'id' => "77cea323f0ce11e897fd525400007196",
     'code' => "bbn_ide",
     'text' => "BBN's own IDE",
     'cfg' => null,
     'id_alias' => null,
     'value' => "{\"num\":1}"
   ], [
     'id' => "77cea323f0ce11e897fd525400007196",

     'text' => "BBN's own IDE",
     'cfg' => null,
     'id_alias' => null,
     'value' => "{\"num\":1}"
   ]
]

raw_tree.name: raw_tree
raw_tree.summary: Returns a hierarchical structure as stored in its original form in the database
raw_tree.description:
*
```php
bbn\X::dump($opt->native_raw_tree('77cea323f0ce11e897fd525400007196'));
/*
array [
  'id' => 12,
  'code' => "bbn_ide",
  'text' => "BBN's own IDE",
  'id_alias' => null,
  'value' => "{\"myProperty\":\"My property's value\"}",
  'items' => [
    [
      'id' => 25,
      'code' => "test",
      'text' => "Test",
      'id_alias' => null,
      'value' => "{\"myProperty\":\"My property's value\"}",
    ],
    [
      'id' => 26,
      'code' => "test2",
      'text' => "Test 2",
      'id_alias' => null,
      'value' => "{\"myProperty\":\"My property's value\"}",
      'items' => [
        [
          'id' => 42,
          'code' => "test8",
          'text' => "Test 8",
          'id_alias' => null,
          'value' => "{\"myProperty\":\"My property's value\"}",
        ]
      ]
    ],
  ]
]
```

option_no_alias.name: option_no_alias
option_no_alias.summary: Returns an option's full content as an array without its values changed by id_alias

get_value.name: get_value

option.name: option
option.summary: Returns an option's full content as an array

options.name: options
options.summary: Returns an array of options in the form id => text

options_by_code.name: options_by_code
options_by_code.summary: Returns an array of children options in the form code => text
options_by_code.description:
*
```php
bbn\X::dump($opt->optionsByCode(12));
/*
array [
  'opt21' => "My option 21",
  'opt22' => "My option 22",
  'opt25' => "My option 25",
  'opt27' => "My option 27"
]
```

text_value_options.name: text_value_options
text_value_options.summary: Returns an option's children array of id and text in a user-defined indexed array
text_value_options.description:
*
```php
bbn\X::dump($opt->text_value_option(12, 'title'));
/* value comes from the default argument
array [
  ['title' => "My option 21", 'value' =>  21],
  ['title' => "My option 22", 'value' =>  22],
  ['title' => "My option 25", 'value' =>  25],
  ['title' => "My option 27", 'value' =>  27]
]
```

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The text field name for text column

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: The value field name for id column

siblings.name: siblings

full_options.name: full_options
full_options.summary: Returns an array of full options arrays for a given parent
full_options.description:
*
```php
bbn\X::dump($opt->fullOptions(12));
/*
array [
  ['id' => 21, 'id_parent' => 12, 'title' => "My option 21", 'myProperty' =>  "78%"],
  ['id' => 22, 'id_parent' => 12, 'title' => "My option 22", 'myProperty' =>  "26%"],
  ['id' => 25, 'id_parent' => 12, 'title' => "My option 25", 'myProperty' =>  "50%"],
  ['id' => 27, 'id_parent' => 12, 'title' => "My option 27", 'myProperty' =>  "40%"]
]
```

full_options_by_id.name: full_options_by_id
full_options_by_id.summary: Returns an id-indexed array of full options arrays for a given parent
full_options_by_id.description:
*
```php
bbn\X::dump($opt->fullOptions(12));
/*
array [
  21 => ['id' => 21, 'id_parent' => 12, 'title' => "My option 21", 'myProperty' =>  "78%"],

  25 => ['id' => 25, 'id_parent' => 12, 'title' => "My option 25", 'myProperty' =>  "50%"],
  27 => ['id' => 27, 'id_parent' => 12, 'title' => "My option 27", 'myProperty' =>  "40%"]
]
```

full_options_by_code.name: full_options_by_code
full_options_by_code.summary: Returns an id-indexed array of full options arrays for a given parent
full_options_by_code.description:
*
```php

/*
array [
  21 => ['id' => 21, 'id_parent' => 12, 'title' => "My option 21", 'myProperty' =>  "78%"],

]
```

full_options_cfg.name: full_options_cfg
full_options_cfg.summary: Returns an id-indexed array of full options with the config in arrays for a given parent
full_options_cfg.description:
*
```php
bbn\X::dump($opt->fullOptionsCfg(12));
/*
array [
  ['id' => 21, 'id_parent' => 12, 'num' => 1, 'title' => "My option 21", 'myProperty' =>  "78%", 'cfg' => ['sortable' => true, 'desc' => "I am a description"]],
  ['id' => 22, 'id_parent' => 12, 'num' => 2, 'title' => "My option 22", 'myProperty' =>  "26%", 'cfg' => ['desc' => "I am a description"]],
  ['id' => 25, 'id_parent' => 12, 'num' => 3, 'title' => "My option 25", 'myProperty' =>  "50%", 'cfg' => ['desc' => "I am a description"]],
  ['id' => 27, 'id_parent' => 12, 'num' => 4, 'title' => "My option 27", 'myProperty' =>  "40%", 'cfg' => ['desc' => "I am a description"]]
]
```

soptions.name: soptions
soptions.summary: Returns an id-indexed array of options in the form id => text for a given grandparent

[
  21 => "My option 21",
  22 => "My option 22",
  25 => "My option 25",
  27 => "My option 27",
  31 => "My option 31",
  32 => "My option 32",
  35 => "My option 35",
  37 => "My option 37"
]
```

]

tree_ids.name: tree_ids
tree_ids.summary: Returns a flat array of all IDs found in a hierarchical structure (except the top one)

description_parts.content: The second parameter is private and should be left blank *

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The resulting array

]
```

tree.name: tree
tree.summary: Returns a simple hierarchical structure with just text, id and items

get_cfg.name: get_cfg
get_cfg.summary: Returns a formatted content of the cfg column as an array
get_cfg.description:
Checks if the parent option has inheritance and sets array accordingly
Parent rules will be applied if with the following inheritance values:
- 'children': if the option is the direct parent
- 'cascade': any level of parenthood
   *
```php
bbn\X::dump($opt->getCfg(25));
/*
array [
  'sortable' => true,
  'cascade' => true,
  'id_alias' => null,
]
```

description_parts.content:
Checks if the parent option has inheritance and sets array accordingly Parent rules will be applied if with the following inheritance values:

  • 'children': if the option is the direct parent
  • 'cascade': any level of parenthood *

get_raw_cfg.name: get_raw_cfg
get_raw_cfg.summary: Returns the raw content of the cfg column for the given option.

get_parent_cfg.name: get_parent_cfg
get_parent_cfg.summary: Returns a formatted content of the cfg column as an array from the option's parent

parents.name: parents
parents.summary: Returns an array of id_parents from the option selected to root

sequence.name: sequence
sequence.summary: Returns an array of id_parents from the selected root to the given id_option

arguments.name: id_option
arguments.description: root

get_id_parent.name: get_id_parent

parent.name: parent
parent.summary: Returns the parent's option as {@link option()}

is_parent.name: is_parent
is_parent.summary: Return true if row with ID $id_parent is parent at any level of row with ID $id

get_codes.name: get_codes
get_codes.summary: Returns an array of options in the form id => code

code.name: code

text.name: text

alias.name: alias
alias.summary: Returns the id_alias relative to the given id_option

itext.name: itext
itext.summary: Returns translation of an option's text

count.name: count
count.summary: Returns the number of children for a given option

options_by_alias.name: options_by_alias
options_by_alias.summary: Returns an array of options based on their id_alias

is_sortable.name: is_sortable
is_sortable.summary: Tells if an option has its config set as sortable or no

get_path_array.name: get_path_array
get_path_array.summary: Returns an array of codes for each option between $id and $root without $root's code

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The start/origin of the path, {@link get_default()} if is null

from_path.name: from_path
from_path.summary: Returns the closest ID option from a _path_ of codes, with separator and optional id_parent

arguments.name: path
arguments.description: The separator

arguments.name: sep
arguments.description: An optional id_parent, {@link get_default()} otherwise

to_path.name: to_path
to_path.summary: Concatenates the codes and separator $sep of a a line of options

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The separator

arguments.name: sep
arguments.description: The start/origin of the path

add.name: add
add.summary: Creates a new option or a new hierarchy by adding row(s) in the options' table

arguments.name: it
arguments.description: Determines if the option should be updated if it already exists

arguments.name: force
arguments.description: num If set to true the function will return the number of rows inserted otherwise the ID of the newly created option

set.name: set
set.summary: Updates an option's row (without changing cfg)
set.description:
*
```php
bbn\X::dump($opt->set(12, [
  'id_parent' => $opt->fromCode('bbn_ide'),
  'text' => 'My new option',
  'code' => 'new_opt',
  'myProperty' => 'my value'
  'cfg' => [
    'sortable' => true,
    'Description' => "I am a cool option"
  ]
]);
// (int) 1
```

merge.name: merge
merge.summary: Updates an option's row (without changing cfg)
merge.description:
*
```php
bbn\X::dump($opt->set(12, [
  'id_parent' => $opt->fromCode('bbn_ide'),
  'text' => 'My new option',
  'code' => 'new_opt',
  'myProperty' => 'my value'
  'cfg' => [
    'sortable' => true,
    'Description' => "I am a cool option"
  ]
]);
// (int) 1
```

remove.name: remove
remove.summary: Deletes a row from the options table, deletes the cache and fix order if needed

remove_full.name: remove_full
remove_full.summary: Deletes a row from the options table, deletes the cache and fix order if needed

set_alias.name: set_alias
set_alias.summary: Sets the alias of an option

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The alias' option ID

set_text.name: set_text
set_text.summary: Sets the text of an option

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The new text

set_code.name: set_code
set_code.summary: Sets the code of an option

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The new code

order.name: order
order.summary: Returns the order of an option. Updates it if a position is given, and cascades

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The new position

set_prop.name: set_prop
set_prop.summary: Updates option's properties derivated from the value column

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: An array of properties and values, or a string with the property's name adding as next argument the new value

get_prop.name: get_prop

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The property's name

unset_prop.name: unset_prop
unset_prop.summary: Unset option's properties taken from the value column

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: An array of properties and values, or a string with the property's name adding as next argument the new value

set_cfg.name: set_cfg
set_cfg.summary: Sets the cfg column of a given option in the table through an array

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The config value

unset_cfg.name: unset_cfg
unset_cfg.summary: Unsets the cfg column (sets it to null)

description_parts.content:
bbn\X::dump($opt->getCfg('bbn_ide'));
// array ['desc' => "I am a cool option", 'sortable' => true];

fusion.name: fusion
fusion.summary: Merges an option $src into an existing option $dest
fusion.description:
Children will change id_parent and references in the same database will be updated
The config will remain the one from the destination

description_parts.content: Children will change id_parent and references in the same database will be updated The config will remain the one from the destination

arguments.name: src
arguments.description: Destination option ID, will remain after the fusion

move.name: move
move.summary: Changes the id_parent of an option

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: parent The new id_parent

fix_order.name: fix_order
fix_order.summary: Sets the order configuration for each options of a sortable given parent

get_code_path.name: get_code_path

analyze_out.name: analyze_out

export.name: export
export.summary: Converts an option or a hierarchy to a multi-level array with JSON values
export.description:
If $return is false the resulting array will be printed
   *
```php
```

description_parts.content: If $return is false the resulting array will be printed *

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The ID of the option to clone

arguments.name: deep
arguments.description: If set to true children will be included

arguments.name: return
arguments.description: If set to true the resulting array will be returned

import.name: import
import.summary: Insert into the option table an exported array of options

arguments.name: options
arguments.description: An array of option(s) as export returns it

arguments.name: id_parent
arguments.description: parent The option target, if not specified {@link default}

duplicate.name: duplicate
duplicate.summary: Copies and insert an option into a target option

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The source option's ID

arguments.name: target
arguments.description: The destination option's ID

arguments.name: deep
arguments.description: If set to true, children will also be duplicated

arguments.name: force
arguments.description: If set to true and option exists it will be merged

apply.name: apply
apply.summary: Applies a function to children of an option and updates the database

arguments.name: f
arguments.description: The function to apply (the unique argument will be the option as in {@link option()}

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The options'ID on which children the function should be applied

arguments.name: deep
arguments.description: If set to true the function will be applied to all children's levels

map.name: map
map.summary: Applies a function to children of an option

arguments.name: f
arguments.description: The function to apply (the unique argument will be the option as in {@link option()}

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The options'ID on which children the function should be applied

arguments.name: deep
arguments.description: If set to true the function will be applied to all children's levels

map_cfg.name: map_cfg
map_cfg.summary: Applies a function to children of an option, with the cfg array included

arguments.name: f
arguments.description: The function to apply (the unique argument will be the option as in {@link option()}

arguments.name: id
arguments.description: The options'ID on which children the function should be applied

arguments.name: deep
arguments.description: If set to true the function will be applied to all children's levels

summary: An all-in-one hierarchical options management system
description:
*
This class allows to:
---------------------
* manage a **hierarchical** table of options
* retrieve, edit, add, remove options
* grab a whole tree
* apply functions on group of options
* add user-defined properties
* set option configuration and applies it to all its children
* And many more...

description_parts.content:
* This class allows to:

  • manage a hierarchical table of options
  • retrieve, edit, add, remove options
  • grab a whole tree
  • apply functions on group of options
  • add user-defined properties
  • set option configuration and applies it to all its children
  • And many more...
